-	Improvements to the zebra crossings to improve crossing safety.

-	Provision of a solar shade for approximately 75 pupils.
-	Construction of pedestrian footpath leading up to the bus stop.

title: Railway Bridge Project
description:
Hampshire County Council (HCC) own and maintain Havant Footbridge which crosses the railway at Havant in Hampshire. Whilst the footbridge is not part of the station infrastructure it is positioned within Network Rail (NR) land, with main span supports on the station platforms and access ramps within the forecourt and on NR non-operational land. Some sections are also within Havant Borough Council (HBC) land 

The footbridge was built in 1947 and provides the main public route over the railway.

title: EAN - AOMR - Lot 1 - BRE017- Cradge Bank Repairs 25-26
description:
Cradge bank form part of one of the embankments of the Ouse Washes Flood storage reservoir. It has
identified that the wash face of the bank has eroded during winter and rutted the bank crest and
tree/bushes on the bank. Also last winter an emergency repairs to a low spot downstream Earith carried out
but some material on the repaired section has washed towards the Wash. The project is to repair erosion on
the back of the bank, rutting on the crest, reprofile the low spot and tree work.

title: Downs to the Sea - Ferry Fields Wetland Enhancement
description:
Ferry Field is split into two distinct sections: a saline lagoon and freshwater wet grassland. The saline lagoon hosts a range of waders and wildfowl, but in summer it dries out hugely. This makes the pool hypersaline and unable to support important flora and fauna.

The wet grassland part of the field also struggles to hold water. Although natural rills can be seen they are ill-defined and need refreshing. There is huge predation pressure around this field from foxes and badgers, meaning even

title: Downs to the Sea - Wet and Wadery
description:
The wetland at RSPB Pulborough Brooks has potential to be a haven for breeding waders and wildfowl. However, there is little control over water on the site. This means that during flood events in winter, water cannot leave site quickly enough. However, when the water levels do drop, they fall too far, and water becomes scarce.

By installing 4 new hydrological structures, water control can be regained across the site to create ideal habitat for the flora and fauna found on the SSSI.

title: Infrastructure Maintenance and Improvements

Southend-on-Sea City Council ("the Authority") is seeking expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced organisations to maintain, manage and improve its highway network and associated assets.

title: Highways Asset Management and Civils Framework 2025-2029
description:
Bristol City Council wishes to appoint a number of providers onto a framework for the provision of Highways Asset Management and Civils Work. The framework will be in place for four years with 10 lots as follows:

- Lot 1: Machine Laid Surfacing
- Lot 2: Surface Dressing and Micro Asphalts
- Lot 3: Slurry Seal and Preventative Treatments
